pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:0.5.eng: 80. The training rule on leaving without giving consent

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅgho sannipatito hoti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.2.eng: the Sangha had gathered on some business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.3.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū cīvarakammaṃ karontā ekassa chandaṃ adaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.3.eng: The monks from the group of six were busy making robes and so they gave their consent to one among them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.4.pli: Atha kho saṅgho “yassatthāya sannipatito taṃ kammaṃ karissāmī”ti ñattiṃ ṭhapesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.4.eng: When the Sangha was ready to do the legal procedure for which it had gathered, it put forward a motion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.5.eng: That monk from the group of six thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.6.pli: “evamevime ekamekassa kammaṃ karonti, kassa tumhe kammaṃ karissathā”ti chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.6.eng: “This is just how they do legal procedures against us one by one, but against who will you do this one?” and without giving his consent, he got up from his seat and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.8.eng: “When the Sangha is in the middle of a discussion, how could that monk get up from his seat and leave without giving his consent?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.12.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkameyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:1.15.1.eng: ‘When the Sangha is in the middle of a discussion, if a monk gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.5.eng: When the Sangha is in the middle of a discussion:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.6.pli: vatthu vā ārocitaṃ hoti avinicchitaṃ, ñatti vā ṭhapitā hoti, kammavācā vā vippakatā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.6.eng: when the topic has been announced but the discussion has not yet been concluded, or when the motion has been put forward, or when the announcement is still under way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.7.eng: Gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.8.pli: “kathaṃ idaṃ kammaṃ kuppaṃ assa vaggaṃ assa na kareyyā”ti gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.8.eng: if he leaves, thinking, “How may this legal procedure be disturbed?” or “How may this legal procedure be done by an incomplete assembly?” or “How may this legal procedure not be done?” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.8.comm: I read the Pali as if kathaṁ idaṁ kammaṁ is to be distributed over the next three phrases: kathaṁ idaṁ kammaṁ kuppaṁ assa, kathaṁ idaṁ kammaṁ vaggaṁ assa, kathaṁ idaṁ kammaṁ na kareyyā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.9.eng: If he is in the process of going beyond arm’s reach of the gathering, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.1.10.eng: When he has gone beyond arm’s reach, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamati, anāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he gets up from his seat and leaves without first giving his consent, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.2.pli: “saṅghassa bhaṇḍanaṃ vā kalaho vā viggaho vā vivādo vā bhavissatī”ti gacchati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.2.eng: if he leaves because he thinks there will be quarrels or disputes in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.3.eng: if he leaves because he thinks there will be a fracture or schism in the Sangha;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.4.pli: “adhammena vā vaggena vā na kammārahassa vā kammaṃ karissatī”ti gacchati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.4.eng: if he leaves because he thinks the legal procedure will be illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done against one who does not deserve it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.5.eng: if he leaves because he is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.6.eng: if he leaves because he has to take care of someone who is sick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.7.pli: uccārena vā passāvena vā pīḷito gacchati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.7.eng: if he leaves because he needs to relieve himself;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.8.eng: if he leaves with the intention to return, and not because he wants to invalidate the legal procedure;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc80:2.3.11.eng: The training rule on leaving without giving consent, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:0.5.eng: 81. The training rule on what is worn out

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā dabbo mallaputto saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeti bhattāni ca uddisati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.2.eng: Venerable Dabba the Mallian, who was the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.3.eng: had a robe that was worn out.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa ekaṃ cīvaraṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.4.eng: Just then the Sangha had obtained a robe,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.5.pli: Atha kho saṅgho taṃ cīvaraṃ āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa adāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.6.eng: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized it,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.7.eng: “The monks are diverting the Sangha’s material things according to friendship.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.8.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.9.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six give out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticize it afterwards?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.13.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjeyya ‘yathāsanthutaṃ bhikkhū saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇāmentī’ti, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticizes it afterwards, saying, “The monks are diverting the Sangha’s material things according to friendship,” he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.6.eng: belonging to the same Buddhist sect and staying within the same monastery zone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.8.pli: channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ vikappanupagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.8.eng: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.8.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6. According to Kd 8:21.1.4 the size referred to here is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”. For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.12.eng: according to friendship, according to companionship, according to who one is devoted to, according to being a co-student, according to being a co-pupil.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.14.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.16.eng: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies; even a bit of bath powder, a tooth cleaner, or a piece of string.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.18.pli: upasampannassa saṅghena sammatassa senāsanapaññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa vā yāgubhājakassa vā phalabhājakassa vā khajjabhājakassa vā appamattakavissajjakassa vā cīvaraṃ dinne khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.18.eng: when robe-cloth has been given to someone who is fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of congee or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of fresh foods or the distributor of minor requisites, and he has been appointed by the Sangha as such, then if a monk criticizes the giving, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.1.18.comm: These are all formally appointed officers of the Sangha. | According to Sp 2.615 (commenting on the sekhiya rules) khajjaka refers to all fresh foods: ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ , “Here the fresh foods which are roots, etc., may all be taken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.1.pli: Dhammakamme dhammakammasaññī cīvaraṃ dinne khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he criticizes the giving of robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.2.pli: Dhammakamme vematiko cīvaraṃ dinne khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he criticizes the giving of robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.3.pli: Dhammakamme adhammakammasaññī cīvaraṃ dinne khiyyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he criticizes the giving of robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.4.pli: Aññaṃ parikkhāraṃ dinne khiyyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.4.eng: If he criticizes the giving of another requisite, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.5.pli: Upasampannassa saṅghena asammatassa senāsanapaññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa vā yāgubhājakassa vā phalabhājakassa vā khajjabhājakassa vā appamattakavissajjakassa vā cīvaraṃ vā aññaṃ vā parikkhāraṃ dinne khiyyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.5.eng: When robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to someone who is fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of congee or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of fresh foods or the distributor of minor requisites, but he has not been appointed by the Sangha as such, then if a monk criticizes the giving, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.6.pli: Anupasampannassa saṅghena sammatassa vā asammatassa vā senāsanapaññāpakassa vā bhattuddesakassa vā yāgubhājakassa vā phalabhājakassa vā khajjabhājakassa vā appamattakavissajjakassa vā cīvaraṃ vā aññaṃ vā parikkhāraṃ dinne khiyyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.6.eng: When robe-cloth or another requisite has been given to someone who is not fully ordained and who is the assigner of dwellings or the designator of meals or the distributor of congee or the distributor of fruit or the distributor of fresh foods or the distributor of minor requisites, whether he has been appointed by the Sangha as such or not, then if a monk criticizes the giving, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.7.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.8.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.2.9.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.2.pli: pakatiyā chandā dosā mohā bhayā karontaṃ “kvattho tassa dinnena laddhāpi vinipātessati na sammā upanessatī”ti khiyyati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.2.eng: if he criticizes one who regularly acts out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear, saying, “What’s the point of giving it to him—he’ll ruin it or use it inappropriately;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc81:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on what is worn out, the eleventh, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ aññatarassa pūgassa saṅghassa sacīvarabhattaṃ paṭiyattaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.2.eng: an association had prepared a meal together with robe-cloth for the Sangha. They said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.3.eng: “After giving the food, we’ll offer the robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.4.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yena so pūgo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.4.eng: But the monks from the group of six went to that association

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.6.eng: “Please give the robe-cloth to these monks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.8.eng: We’ve prepared our annual alms-offering together with robe-cloth for the Sangha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.9.pli: “Bahū, āvuso, saṅghassa dāyakā, bahū saṅghassa bhattā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.9.eng: “The Sangha has many donors and supporters.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.10.pli: Ime tumhe nissāya tumhe sampassantā idha viharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.10.eng: But since these monks are staying here, they are looking to you for support.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.11.pli: Tumhe ce imesaṃ na dassatha, atha ko carahi imesaṃ dassati?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.11.eng: If you don’t give to them, who will?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.13.pli: Atha kho so pūgo chabbaggiyehi bhikkhūhi nippīḷiyamāno yathāpaṭiyattaṃ cīvaraṃ chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ datvā saṅghaṃ bhattena parivisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.13.eng: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robe-cloth to those monks and served the food to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū jānanti saṅghassa sacīvarabhattaṃ paṭiyattaṃ “na ca jānanti chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dinnan”ti te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.14.eng: The monks who knew that a meal together with robe-cloth had been prepared for the Sangha, but not that the robe-cloth had been given to those monks from the group of six, said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.17.pli: Yathāpaṭiyattaṃ cīvaraṃ ayyā chabbaggiyā ayyānaṃ chabbaggiyānaṃ pariṇāmesun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.17.eng: The robe-cloth we had prepared was diverted by the monks from the group of six.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.18.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.18.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.19.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.19.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six divert to an individual things they knew were intended for the Sangha?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.20.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.20.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.23.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.23.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.25.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.25.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.26.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.26.1.eng: ‘If a monk diverts to an individual material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.6.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it simply refers to the donor telling the monk directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.8.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.10.eng: robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies; even a bit of bath powder, a tooth cleaner, or a piece of string.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.12.pli: “dassāma karissāmā”ti vācā bhinnā hoti, taṃ puggalassa pariṇāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.12.eng: if they have said, “We’ll give,” “We’ll prepare,” and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.1.pli: Pariṇate pariṇatasaññī puggalassa pariṇāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.1.eng: If it was intended for the Sangha and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.2.pli: Pariṇate vematiko puggalassa pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.2.eng: If it was intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.3.eng: If it was intended for the Sangha, but he does not perceive it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.4.pli: Saṅghassa pariṇataṃ aññasaṅghassa vā cetiyassa vā pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.4.eng: If it was intended for one Sangha and he diverts it to another Sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.5.pli: Cetiyassa pariṇataṃ aññacetiyassa vā saṅghassa vā puggalassa vā pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.5.eng: If it was intended for one shrine and he diverts it to another shrine or to a sangha or to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.6.pli: Puggalassa pariṇataṃ aññapuggalassa vā saṅghassa vā cetiyassa vā pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.6.eng: If it was intended for an individual and he diverts it to another individual or to a sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.7.eng: If it was not intended for the Sangha, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.8.eng: If it was not intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.9.eng: If it was not intended for the Sangha and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.3.pli: “yattha tumhākaṃ deyyadhammo paribhogaṃ vā labheyya paṭisaṅkhāraṃ vā labheyya ciraṭṭhitiko vā assa yattha vā pana tumhākaṃ cittaṃ pasīdati tattha dethā”ti bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.3.eng: “Where may we give?” he says, “Give where your gift will be useful,” “… where it goes toward repairs,” “… where it will last for a long time,” “… where you feel inspired;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.6.eng: The training rule on diverting, the twelfth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.7.eng: The eighth subchapter on legitimately is finished.
